content: Investments Asked by AnonymousAsked on 08 Jun 2018Which REITS ETF should I consider to buy?3 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (3)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent
Kenneth ChiaLevel 3. WonderkidAnswered on 11 Jun 2018In my opinion, ETFs may not be the most tax friendly vehicle compared to buying Reits individually and building a mini portfolio0 comments0

Alan SeowLevel 3. WonderkidUpdated on 07 Jun 2019The one with the lowest cost. But having said that. REITs ETFs are subject to withholding tax which reduces distributable income by 17 percent. I advise doing research if u plan to put in alot of money into a few good REITs 1 comment0
Jay Liu13 Jun 2018The 17% withholding tax will be removed after July 1st

Alex GohLevel 1. FreshieAnswered on 09 Jun 2018I’m going to throw a couple of uncommon ones for the purpose of exposure and learning. Also if you believe in diversification, purchasing of singapore reits or stocks increases your concentration in geographical risk of Singapore (ie. our careers in Singapore, property in Singapore, etc)​IWDP ETF - listed in LSE, gives exposure to developed markets property yield. Skewed largely to US (50%)​IPRP ETF - listed in LSE, gives exposure to the European property yield. largest exposure in Germany (35%)​1343 ETF - listed in japan, gives exposure to Japanese reits. ​​​0 comments0
